issue.title: [Python] Add scalar value support for Dictionary type
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-552](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-552). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
There is not a `DictionaryValue` implemented in `pyarrow.scalar`

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-552?focusedCommentId=15934533) by Miki Tebeka (tebeka):*
I have initial implementation in [my branch](https://github.com/tebeka/arrow/compare/master...ARROW-552). However this currently segfaults and I'm having hard time debugging it.

I **think** the problem is `py_idx = box_scalar(self.type, darr.indices(), i).as_py()` but not sure.

Any ideas on how to fix this?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-552?focusedCommentId=15934593) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Just looked. You're right, `box_scalar(self.type, darr.indices(), i)` isn't right because the dictionary type (`self.type`) and the indices don't match. Try passing the index_type instead from

https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/cpp/src/arrow/type.h#L580

(it needs to be boxed)

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-552?focusedCommentId=15934605) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
You could make things a little easier by adding an `indices` property to DictionaryArray that returns the dictionary indices as a boxed array – being able to inspect the indices is independently useful

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-552?focusedCommentId=15934663) by Miki Tebeka (tebeka):*
Fixed the bug with type, however now I got an error which probably means dereferencing twice.
